Dear Roman John Kolodchin:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or
otherwise suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, when youth resided at the facility, they
made a joke and a staff member threatened to stab them.
Investigation Interviews:
On 09/30/2024 and 10/7/24 telephone calls were attempted to
Complainant. Message indicated caller not available, unable to
leave a message.
On 10/03/2024 a telephone call was made to Youth A. A
voicemail message was left requesting a return call from Youth A
or one of her parents regarding her placement at SafeHaus.
The following interviews were completed onsite at Safehaus
Too on 10/04/2024 unless otherwise noted.
An onsite visit was made to Safehaus Too to initiate investigation.
An interview was completed with Supervisor 1. She was advised
of allegations of investigation. She confirmed that Youth A was
placed at SafeHaus Too from 9/16/2024 to 9/26/2024. She
recalled that Youth A was very quiet, and she does not recall any
issues with staff. She denied that any of the youth that were
residents of the agency during that time are still in the program.
Supervisor 1 was familiar with the allegations of the investigation.
She provided copies of written statements from Youth A and other
youth in the program at that time. Supervisor 1 denied ever
making threats to Youth A or any other youth in the program.
An interview was completed with Staff 1. She was familiar with
Youth A and recalled the time when the youth was placed with the
facility. She denied making any threats toward Youth A or making
any statements that youth would find offensive. Staff 1 reported
that she has a good rapport with the youth in the program and has
success with them following agency rules and responding to her
redirection. After discussing the agency investigation that was
completed regarding the incident, additional questions were asked
of Staff 1. She acknowledged that she had been asked questions
2

by the Program Manager regrading the incident, but maintained
her report that she did not make any threats toward youth in the
program, specifically Youth A. She further denied making
statements to any of the youth that would make them feel
uncomfortable. Staff 1 did recall an incident when a youth asked
her for a blow pop (candy sucker) and she made a motion with her
hand faking like she was going to give them a sucker but did not.
She denied making any sexual motions or statements to the
youth. She lastly indicated she is not sure why Youth A, Youth B,
Youth C and Youth D would make verbal or written statements
saying that she did.
An interview was completed with Staff 2. She has worked at the
agency for 7 months. She denied any knowledge of Staff 1
making threats toward youth in the program or making statements
that would make them feel uncomfortable. She further stated that
no youth have advised her that they have been threatened by or
made feel uncomfortable by Staff 1 or any other agency
employee.
An interview was held with Youth E and Youth F. Youth E
confirmed that she was placed at the facility since 9/28/24 and
Youth F since 9/25/2024. They both report feeling safe at the
agency and denied being threatened by staff. They further denied
knowledge of any other youth being threatened or reported that
they had been threatened. They reported having a good
relationship with Staff 1 and denied that she has ever made either
of them feel uncomfortable.
On 10/07/2024 and 10/21/2024 telephone call attempts were
made to contact number for Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and
Youth D. Voicemail messages were left to return call to discuss
placement at Safehaus too.
On 11/19/2024 a telephone call was made to Staff 3. A voicemail
message was left to return call with any additional information
relevant to the written statement she provided on 9/22/2024.
Document Review:
Safehaus Agency Behavior Management Policy: Policy
prohibits the use of threats toward youth in the program.
Safehaus Executive Summary of Events: Report dated
9/21/2024 indicates that Staff A was involved and failed to follow
agency behavior management policy. Specifically, it indicated that
youth reported Staff 1 made inappropriate and threatening
3

gestures toward them. Disciplinary action indicated that Staff 1
would serve a two-day suspension, attend sensitivity and recipient
rights training.
Written Statement by Youth A: Staff 1 really did not say
anything to me, but I witnessed a couple of things and I feel
uncomfortable being around her after she threatened me.
Written Statement by Youth B: Staff 1 told Youth G to stop
being racist multiple times, but she continued to make fun of
Youth D for being Indian. Youth G was making Indian type noises
toward Youth D. Staff 1 told the group that she felt if we jumped
her, a couple of us would be stabbed with a knife. Youth B went
on to say that she feels really uncomfortable around Staff 1. She
further stated that she felt uncomfortable because Staff 1 made an
inappropriate gesture by saying you get a sucker over and over
again and faking like she was getting the sucker from her private
area and throwing it.
Written Statement by Youth C: Staff 1 called me ugly and stated
she was going to stab all of us.
Written Statement by Youth D: Staff 1 was making us all feel
uncomfortable. She said she was going to stab us if we jumped
her. She was making fun of my race and being inappropriate to
us. She called Youth C ugly and called me fat.
Written Statement by Staff 3: On Saturday the 21st I worked at
house too during the afternoon shift. While in the basement the
girls asked how to make a complaint about a staff member. They
then told me that Staff 1 threatened to stab them when one of the
youth made a joke about jumping her. They also told me that she
made comments about one of the girls being fat. They also told
me they were talking about suckers (candy) and one of the girls
told Staff 1 that she wanted a blow pop and Staff 1 turned around
so that her butt was towards them and then acted like she was
pulling something out of her butt.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 4158-1-a-iii. Both youth and
staff were interviewed, and it was assessed that it is likely that the
staff made comments to the youth that could be assessed as
threatening.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

Rule Code Program Statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 : Rule 109. (1) An institution shall have and
Section follow a current written program statement which specifically
Description (c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety,
and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings
Type
Allegation Staff was utilizing personal cell phone while at work
Investigation Interviews:
On 10/04/2024 an interview was completed with Staff 1. She
reported that she made a personal call on her cell phone during
her work shift. She denied making any threats toward youth while
on the phone or yelling or screaming at the youth.
Document Review:
Safehaus Agency Policy: Policy indicates that staff are not
allowed to have their personal phones on them during their shift
and that the cell phones are to be placed in their lock box in the
main office.
Safehaus Executive Summary of Events: Report dated
9/21/2024 indicates that Staff 1 was involved and failed to follow
agency policy regarding personal cell phone use at work.
Disciplinary action indicated that Staff 1 would serve a two day
suspension, attend sensitivity training and agree to use of lock box
for personal belongings.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 4109-1-C. Staff 1 admitted
to use of her personal cell phone during her shift.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
